pages.title: About
pages.text: Hi there, I took these notes when I found something interesting or when I learn something new. I try to make it concise and easy to understand in order to quickly revise it when needed. It’s useful for me, perhaps it’s useful for others too. Feel free to suggest any ideas or opinions to improve it.

posts.title: Hypothesis Testing and p-values
posts.text: This note uses All of Statistics: A Concise Course in Statistical Inference written by Larry Wasserman as references. Hypothesis TestingWe use hypothesis testing to examine an assumption. Hypothesis Testing is like a legal trial. We assume someone is innocient unless the evidence strongly suggests that he is guilty. Similarly, we retain H0 unless there is strong evidence to reject H0.
